abstract.text: Returns the color object’s RGB component and opacity values in the respective arguments.

inlineContent.text: Upon return, contains the red component of the color object.
Upon return, contains the green component of the color object.
Upon return, contains the blue component of the color object.
Upon return, contains the opacity value of the color object.
is passed in as an argument, the method doesn’t set that value. This method works only with objects representing colors in the
color space. Sending it to other objects raises an exception.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).
The alpha (opacity) component value of the color.
The blue component value of the color.
Returns the components of the color as an array.
Returns the color object’s CMYK and opacity values.
Returns the color object’s HSB component and opacity values in the respective arguments.
Returns the color object’s RGB component and opacity values in the respective arguments.
Returns the grayscale and alpha values of the color.
The green component value of the color.
The number of components in the color.
The red component value of the color.
Calibrated color space with red, green, blue, and alpha components.
Device-dependent color space with red, green, blue, and alpha components.
The basic type for all floating-point values.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
